Articles.Content:
Hello,

Settings aren't saved in my fresh install of KSP (from zip file). I tried removing settings.cfg, changing its permissions, etc... to no avail.

I wouldn't say no settings are persisted at all though - when I start the game, it's fullscreen, at my desktop resolution... and half the time I don't get the "send statistics" dialog. Even though I don't get the dialogs, still important settings such as terrain quality (which is the main setting to lower in my situation, Intel HD 4000 is so slow whenever I have terrain in sight) aren't kept after I closed the game.

Please help! Thanks in advance!

To steal from Vexx:

You might need to be launching KSP with the LC_ALL=C command; see the main Linux thread for details.

Cheers,

~Claw

Hello,

I have the same problem. Actually, the problem is not that KSP does not save the settings.

The real problem is that KSP write a new settings.cfg like it does not exists !

Launching KSP with LC_ALL=C works fine (even with steam). But if a developper can remove this problem, that would be better.

Thanks
